interface.name: zphoc_layer_shell_effects_v1
interface.description: Assigns additional features to layer surfaces

entry.name: bad_anchors
entry.summary: layer surface is not anchored to 3 edges

entry.name: bad_margin
entry.summary: layer surface has no margin to use

request.name: get_draggable_layer_surface
request.description:
This marks a layer surface as draggable via one finger drag on touch or click and drag when using a mouse. E.g. a surface that is anchored to the left, right and top can be dragged to the bottom exposing more of it's surface.
The state with the minimal amount of surface visible is called folded state, the state with the maximum amount of surface visible is called unfolded state. These two states are defined by the layer surfaces margin in those states. During drag the layer surfaces margin is adjusted to move the surface invalidating the margin set on the zwlr_layer_surface_v1 interface. The default folded and unfolded margins are 0.
The threshold ([0.0, 1.0]) specifies how far the user needs to pull out the surface to not slide back into the folded state but rather slide into the unfolded state. The default is 1.0.
The client is responsible for adjusting it's margins when it's size changes to e.g. make sure only the wanted parts of the surface are visible in folded state.
Note that you shouldn't modify exclusive_zone or margins via zwlr_layer_surface_v1 interface directly when using this one.
Margins, threshold and exclusive zone are double buffered and will be applied on the next surface commit.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This request indicates that the client will not use the layer_shell effects object any more. Objects that have been created through this instance are not affected.

interface.name: zphoc_draggable_layer_surface_v1
interface.description: An interface that may be implemented by a layer_surface, for surfaces that are designed to become draggable when anchored at three edges.

request.name: set_margins
request.description:
Sets the folded and unfolded margins. For how they are defined refer to margins in the layer-surface protocol.
Margins are double-buffered, see wl_surface.commit.

request.name: set_threshold
request.description:
How far the surface needs to be pulled to go from folded to unfolded state and vice versa. Ranges 0.0 to 1.0 as fraction of the total margin between folded and unfolded state.
Threshold is double-buffered, see wl_surface.commit.

request.name: set_exclusive
request.description:
Sets the exclusive zone. This is the amount of pixels from the screen edge that shouldn't be occluded by other surfaces.
Exclusive zone is double-buffered, see wl_surface.commit.

request.name: set_drag_mode
request.description:
Specify how the surface can be dragged. The default is "full".
Drag-mode is double-buffered, see wl_surface.commit.

request.name: set_drag_handle
request.description:
Specify the size of the drag handle. The default is 0.
Drag-handle is double-buffered, see wl_surface.commit.

request.name: set_state
request.description: Set state to folded or unfolded. This is applied immediately.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This request destroys the draggable layer surface.

event.name: dragged
event.description:
The is draging the surface.

event.name: drag_end
event.description: The user ended dragging the surface and it entered either folded or unfolded state.

request.name: set_alpha
request.description:
Sets the surfaces transparency. Valid values are between 0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (fully opaque. The set value also effects subsurfaces and popups.
Alpha is double-buffered, see wl_surface.commit.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This request destroys the alpha layer surface.
